content.p: We are here to help you if you have a disability, mental health difficulty, long-term medical condition, autistic spectrum condition, or a specific learning difference such as dyslexia, dyspraxia, dyscalculia or ADHD. Our student-led support enables students with Support Plans to flourish as independent learners. If you are considering applying to Nottingham or hold an offer, take a look at our guidance and FAQs Find out, step-by-step, how to arrange reasonable adjustments for your assessments and teaching Have a question? Find out how to contact us and book an appointment Take a look at the support options available to you and access and inclusion information. Check out our 'things to think about' for different disabilities and long-term conditions Make sure you are aware of the deadlines for arranging your Support Plan Have a Support Plan? Sign up for events and workshops, book appointments with the team and find useful resources If you have a specific learning difference (eg dyslexia, dyspraxia, ADHD), take a look at our informal study skills workshops If you have a Support Plan, check out our guidance to help you transition to university study
